poem:
Title: The Legacy of Beasts

Here, on the threshold of mortality,
one turns not to man-made divinity,
but to brutes and wings and watery smiles.
A dog, loyal, free from human trials,
reaps civilizations fruits amicably,
or be an eagle, fierce and agile,
goat bound high, bereft of guile,
or dolphin joyous in riverine wiles.
Choose your beast; leave man's hostility.
